PROOF:Let $\epsilon>0$ begiven.Choose $N$ sufficientlylargethat $\begin{array}{r}{\sum_{k>N}a_{k}<\epsilon/(4B)}\end{array}$ andpick $N^{\prime}$ large enough so that for all $n\geq N^{\prime}$ 
$$
\left|b_{n}-b_{n-1}\right|\leq{\frac{\epsilon}{2a N}}\cdotp
$$
Thenfor $n\geq N+N^{\prime}$ ,wehave 
$$
\begin{array}{r l}{\lefteqn{\biggl|\sum_{k=0}^{\frac{n}{\gamma}}a_{k}(b_{n}-b_{n-k})\biggr|\leq\sum_{k=0}^{\frac{N}{\gamma}}a_{k}\bigl|b_{n}-b_{n-k}\bigr|+\sum_{k=N+1}^{\frac{n}{\gamma}}a_{k}(|b_{n}|+|b_{n-k}|)}}\ &{\leq\sum_{k=0}^{\frac{N}{\gamma}}a_{k}\sum_{j=0}^{k-1}\bigl|b_{n-j}-b_{n-j-1}\bigr|+2B\sum_{k=N+1}^{\frac{n}{\gamma}}a_{k}}\ &{\leq\sum_{k=0}^{\frac{N}{\gamma}}a_{k}\sum_{j=0}^{k-1}\frac{\epsilon}{2a N}+\frac{\epsilon}{4B}\cdot2B,\mathrm{~since~}n-j\geq N^{\prime}}\ &{\leq\frac{\epsilon}{2a}\sum_{k=0}^{\frac{N}{\gamma}}a_{k}+\frac{\epsilon}{2}}\ &{\leq\epsilon.}\end{array}
$$
Theorem9-7:Let $i,j$ and $k$ be arbitrary states in a recurrentMarkov chain which is either null or noncyclic ergodic.Then 
$$
\operatorname*{lim}_{n\rightarrow\infty}[(N_{k k}^{(n)}-N_{i k}^{(n)})\alpha_{j}/\alpha_{k}+N_{i j}^{(n)}-N_{k j}^{(n)}]=^{k}N_{i j}.
$$
PRooF:Wemayassume thatneither $i$ nor $j$ equals $k$ sinceotherwise both sides are clearly zero.We begin by establishing four equations: 
$$
\begin{array}{l}{{N_{k k}^{(n)}=\displaystyle\sum_{\nu=0}^{\infty}F_{i k}^{(\nu)}N_{k k}^{(n)}}}\ {{{}}}\ {{N_{i k}^{(n)}=\displaystyle\sum_{\nu=0}^{n}F_{i k}^{(\nu)}N_{k k}^{(n-\nu)}}}\ {{{}}}\ {{N_{k j}^{(n)}=\displaystyle\sum_{\nu=0}^{\infty}F_{i k}^{(\nu)}N_{k j}^{(n)}}}\ {{{}}}\ {{N_{i j}^{(n)}=\displaystyle\sum_{\nu=0}^{n}F_{i k}^{(\nu)}N_{k j}^{(n-\nu)}+{}^{k}N_{i j}^{(n)}.}}\end{array}
$$
Equations (l) and (3) follow from the fact that $\sum{F_{i k}^{(\nu)}=H_{i k}=1}$ Equation (2)comes from Theorem 4-1l with the random time $\textbf{t}=$ min $(\mathbf{t}_{k},n)$ ,and equation (4) is a similar result, except that the sum has been broken into two parts representing what happens after and before state $k$ isreached for the first time.
